alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Garvin; McClain; Murray; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 1:06AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Garvin, western Seminole, Cleveland, Pontotoc, northeastern Murray, Pottawatomie and southern McClain Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 106 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Norman to 3 miles southwest of Noble to near Paoli to near Elmore City. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Oklahoma City, Norman, Moore, Shawnee, Ada, Newcastle, Seminole, Tecumseh, Pauls Valley, Purcell, Noble, Slaughterville, Wynnewood, Lexington, Pink, Goldsby, Stratford, Konawa, Maysville, and Byng. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 61 and 112. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cleveland; Garvin; McClain; Murray; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole
